pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces new meta properties for morphism properties: If `P` and `Q` are morphism properties, then `P.RespectsLeft Q` if `P` respects `Q` on the left, i.e. if `P f` implies `P (i â‰« f)` whenever `i` satisfies `Q`. Analogously, `P.RespectsRight Q` if `P` respects `Q` on the right. Finally, `P.Respects Q` if `P` respects `Q` both on the left and on the right.

The current definition of `RespectsIso P` is now an abbreviation for `P.Respects (isomorphisms C)`.

Note that `P.Respects P` is equivalent to `StableUnderComposition P`, but the latter definition was not changed.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
The aim of this generalization is to avoid `StableUnderComposition` assumptions in the algebraic geometry API and replace those by suitable `P.Respects(Left/Right) IsOpenImmersion`.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [347719877a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17139/commits/347719877a4149da926cc2653603e85d1f977b2a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Respects`
`+ RespectsIso.mk`
`+ RespectsIso.postcomp`
`+ RespectsIso.precomp`
`+ RespectsLeft`
`+ RespectsLeft.inf`
`+ RespectsRight`
`+ RespectsRight.inf`
`+ instance (P Q : MorphismProperty C) [P.RespectsLeft Q] : P.op.RespectsRight Q.op`
`+ instance (P Q : MorphismProperty C) [P.RespectsLeft Q] [P.RespectsRight Q] : P.Respects Q`
`+ instance (P Q : MorphismProperty C) [P.RespectsRight Q] : P.op.RespectsLeft Q.op`
`- RespectsIso.inf`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/6903ebb1-e3a1-495b-8d8e-68de325a8b09) for commit 347719877a4149da926cc2653603e85d1f977b2a.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ab71c30e-4371-42f2-b39f-00baa6d20927/to/6903ebb1-e3a1-495b-8d8e-68de325a8b09) against commit 5f551d9f89a062d62820d2b02d2f7782fc5dbf98.

> Note that `P.Respects P` is equivalent to `StableUnderBaseChange P`, but the latter definition was not changed.
Do not you mean `StableUnderComposition P` here?

> > Note that `P.Respects P` is equivalent to `StableUnderBaseChange P`, but the latter definition was not changed.
> > Do not you mean `StableUnderComposition P` here?

Oh yes, indeed, thanks. Edited above.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11055295707/job/30714149257)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11055295707/job/30714149780)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(CategoryTheory/MorphismProperty): introduce meta properties `RespectsLeft` and `RespectsRight`
